intro: Stachyanthus martii, commonly known as the velvetleaf stachyans, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive yellow center. Its leaves are velvety and dark green, contributing to its common name. Stachyanthus martii is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
